law.catch_line: Election of method for securing relief.
law.text:
When a discriminatory housing charge is filed under KRS 344.625, a complainant, a respondent, or the aggrieved person on whose behalf the complaint is filed, may elect to have the claims asserted in that charge decided in a civil action under KRS 344.670, in lieu of an administrative hearing before the commission under KRS 344.640.
The election shall be made not later than twenty (20) days after the receipt by the electing person of service under KRS 344.630, from the commission or, in the case of the commission, not later than twenty (20) days after service to the respondent and complainant.
The person making the election shall give written notice of doing so to the commission and to all other complainants and respondents to whom the charge relates.
law.history: Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 282, sec. 23, effective July 14, 1992.
